segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako cīrāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsi.
segments.en: Now at that time a certain lay follower gave a robe to the nun Cīrā.

segments.pli: Atha kho cīrāya bhikkhuniyā abhippasanno yakkho rājagahe rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi:
segments.en: Then a native spirit was so devoted to Cīrā that he went street to street and square to square, and on that occasion recited these verses:
“O! He has made so much merit!
That lay-follower is so very wise.
He gave a robe to Cīrā,
who is released from all bonds.”

suttaplex.blurb: A spirit was full of faith in the nun Cirā, so he went about the towns and villages singing the benefits of giving her offerings.
